actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on November 13, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Greene (GA) notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Ms. Bonamici asked unanimous consent that she may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 822, a bill originally introduced by Representative Stewart, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.

Mr. Lawler asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on November 9, 2023, it adjourn to meet on Monday, November 13, 2023, at noon for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Pursuant to clause 1(c) of rule XIX, the Chair announced further proceedings on H.R. 4664 would be postponed.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 4664.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Tenney amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 220
On agreeing to the Tenney amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 165
actions-list.actionItem: 257, 1 Present (Roll no. 641).
On agreeing to the Williams (TX) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 847, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Williams (TX) amendment No. 104.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Williams (TX),  numbered 104 printed in Part B of House Report 118-269 to prohibit funding for the Small Business Administration to create any new business lending program.
On agreeing to the Wagner amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 847, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Wagner amendment No. 102.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Wagner,  numbered 102 printed in Part B of House Report 118-269 to prohibit funding to finalize or implement the proposed interpretive guidance of the Financial Stability Oversight Council titled "Authority To Require Supervision and Regulation of Certain Nonbank Financial Companies."

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 101, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Tenney demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 847, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 101.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 101 printed in Part B of House Report 118-269 to prohibit funding to finalize, implement, or enforce the FAR Council's proposed "Federal Acquisition Regulation: Disclosure of Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Climate-Related Financial Risk" rule.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 100, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Hoyer demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 847, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 100.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 100 printed in Part B of House Report 118-269 to reduce the salary of White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre to $1.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4664 â€” "Making appropriations for financial services and general government for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Kildee to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by His Holiness Aram the First Catholicos, Armenian Apostolic Church of the Holy See of Cilicia.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
